featured_projects.name: ClaudeGlobalCommands
featured_projects.description: A comprehensive collection of optimized AI agents and workflows for Claude Code
featured_projects.tagline: 30+ specialized AI agents with 43.7% token reduction
key_features: 30+ specialized AI agents across software development, business, and infrastructure
15+ multi-agent workflows for coordinated automation
43.7% token reduction translating to proportional API cost savings
30-45% faster workflow execution through hierarchical architecture
Automated CSS regression detection using Playwright
60% overhead reduction by adopting YAML format
Intelligent task routing through `/execute` command
Production-ready, battle-tested prompts
implementation_highlights: Hierarchical architecture replaces parallel processing for efficiency
Template extraction eliminates code duplication
Smart caching of common patterns reduces redundant processing
Progressive enhancement loads only necessary components

featured_projects.name: TFE - Terminal File Explorer
featured_projects.description: A powerful and clean terminal-based file explorer built with Go and Bubbletea
featured_projects.tagline: Modern file management with AI prompts library and cross-platform touch support
key_features: Integrated AI prompts library with fillable input fields and variable substitution
Dual-pane split-screen with live preview and syntax highlighting
Full mobile support on Android/Termux with touch gestures
Inline HD image previews via graphics protocols (Kitty, iTerm2, Sixel)
Git workspace intelligence with visual status indicators
Safe file deletion with integrated trash/recycle bin
F-key shortcuts (F1-F12) inspired by Midnight Commander
Context-aware help system that adapts to current mode
impressive_quotes: Only terminal file manager with integrated prompt template library
Works beautifully on desktop and mobile (Termux) with full touch support
implementation_highlights: Native graphics protocol support for HD image rendering
External tool integration (fzf, viu, timg, chafa, micro) with graceful fallbacks
Shell wrapper integration enabling 'Quick CD' directory persistence
Variable substitution system: {{file}}, {{DATE}}, etc.

featured_projects.name: gg-hub
featured_projects.description: Terminal-first developer workspace with beautiful UI
featured_projects.tagline: Browser-based portfolio with integrated multi-terminal support via Tabz
key_features: Manages 20 projects (14 web apps + 6 TUI applications)
Real-time status detection for running development servers
Tabz terminal integration in resizable right sidebar
Multi-terminal support with tmux session management
Smart port management with automatic conflict resolution
50+ developer commands in quick commands panel
Green matrix-themed UI with smooth animations
One-click actions for starting, stopping, and opening projects
implementation_highlights: Tabz embedded via iframe with automatic connectivity detection
Session persistence through tmux
Split pane modes: horizontal, vertical, window, and background
Responsive drag-to-resize sidebar (300px to full width)
Live preview capability for running projects
featured_projects.development_phase: Phase 8 Complete (Tabz UI Integration), Phase 9 Pending (Command Execution Backend)

featured_projects.name: Tabz
featured_projects.description: Simple tab-based terminal interface with React + xterm.js
featured_projects.tagline: Browser-based terminals with 15 terminal types and tmux integration
key_features: Multiple terminals in browser tabs like VS Code's terminal panel
15 terminal types: Claude Code, Bash, TFE, LazyGit, and more
Terminal emulation powered by xterm.js with WebGL rendering
Tmux integration with dual context menus for sessions and panes
Keyboard shortcuts via Alt+Key combinations
Optional gg-hub integration for auto-populated spawn menu
Real-time WebSocket communication for terminal I/O
implementation_highlights: Persistent Node.js backend with PTY (pseudo-terminal) support
Full terminal emulation including ANSI color codes and special characters
Extracted from larger Opustrator project for focused functionality

featured_projects.name: Claude Code WSL Quick Reference
featured_projects.description: Browser-based interactive cheat sheet for Claude Code users new to WSL
featured_projects.tagline: Click-to-copy commands with customizable personal reference library
key_features: Click-to-copy command functionality for instant clipboard access
Organized command categories across 6 main areas
Add custom commands via interface with local persistence
Configure Windows and WSL usernames for accurate path generation
Dark theme interface optimized for extended use
Browser localStorage for automatic customization saving
Termux (Android terminal) support for mobile development
implementation_highlights: Zero external dependencies for maximum portability
Responsive layout from mobile to desktop
Can be deployed to GitHub Pages for personal use

featured_projects.name: bit
featured_projects.description: CLI/TUI logo designer with ANSI font library, gradients, shadows, and export options
featured_projects.tagline: 100+ terminal fonts with advanced effects and multi-language export
key_features: 100+ embedded bitmap fonts (classic terminal, retro gaming, pixel, decorative)
Color gradients (horizontal and vertical directions)
Shadow effects with adjustable position and style
Text scaling from 0.5x to 4x
14 vibrant ANSI colors plus unlimited hex color support
Multi-format export: TXT, Go, JavaScript, Python, Rust, Bash
Character, word, and line spacing adjustments
Multi-line text input with per-row cursor tracking
impressive_quotes: 100+ Font Styles spanning classic, retro gaming, modern pixel, decorative, and monospace designs
All fonts are under permissive open-source licenses for both personal and commercial use
implementation_highlights: Embedded .bit files (JSON format) containing character definitions
Lazy loading for memory efficiency
go:embed for self-contained binaries
Automatic kerning and descender detection
6 control panels for comprehensive customization

Beautiful TUI rendering with mouse and keyboard support
Integrated launcher menu for game selection
Persistent high score tracking and statistics
Satisfying animations (waterfalls, cascade reveals, explosions)
Cross-platform compatibility (Linux, macOS, Windows)
Integration with TFE (Terminal File Explorer)

Multi-select spawning (spacebar selection, Enter to execute)
Tmux integration with configurable layouts (quad splits, tiled)
Context-aware execution adapting to existing sessions
Project-scoped working directories
Saved configuration profiles for complex setups
implementation_highlights: Tree navigation for intuitive browsing
Automatic tmux environment detection
Batch launch support for multiple commands
tui_applications.installation: Clone and run ./install.sh to install tl command

tui_applications.name: tkan
tui_applications.description: Terminal Project Tracker - Kanban board for the terminal

key_features: Visual Kanban board with 5 columns: BACKLOG, TODO, PROGRESS, REVIEW, DONE
Solitaire-style stacked card display with text wrapping
Mouse-driven drag-and-drop between and within columns
Toggleable detail panel for full card metadata
Multi-project support with .tkan.yaml file discovery
Keyboard navigation (arrow keys + vim bindings)
GitHub Projects integration option
Card lifecycle management (create, edit, delete)
implementation_highlights: YAML-based persistence for local storage
Version control integration via plain-text files
Immediate persistence on changes

Real-time updates without manual refresh

browser_extensions.name: TabzChrome
browser_extensions.description: Chrome extension for managing tmux sessions in a persistent sidebar
browser_extensions.tagline: Always-visible terminal access across all browser tabs
key_features: Display active tmux sessions in sidebar panel
Switch between multiple terminal sessions with one click
15+ terminal types (Bash, Claude Code, LazyGit, etc.)
Full xterm.js emulation with real-time I/O
Quick commands panel with built-in and custom shortcuts
Always visible across all browser tabs
Dark and light theme options
Adjustable font sizes (12-24px)
Keyboard shortcut activation (Ctrl+Shift+9)

layers: Chrome Extension (React/TypeScript) - Frontend UI with polling
Node.js Backend (Express) - REST API and WebSocket server
tmux Sessions - Single source of truth for persistence
architecture.approach: Extension queries tmux every 2 seconds rather than managing independent state

implementation_highlights: Eliminated synchronization bugs through tmux polling
40% codebase complexity reduction
Two operation modes: spawn terminals or copy to clipboard
Category-based command organization with persistent storage

templates_and_starters.name: TUITemplate
templates_and_starters.description: TUI templates for Go with Bubble Tea, dynamic layouts, and mouse support
templates_and_starters.tagline: Production-ready framework for building terminal UIs
key_features: Clean separation of concerns (main, types, model, update, view)
Multiple layout systems (single-pane, dual-pane, multi-panel, tabbed)
Complete keyboard and mouse support
Pre-configured Lipgloss styles with theme support
Component library (lists, inputs, dialogs, menus, tables)
Visual effects library (metaballs, waves, rainbow cycling)
9 template files covering all TUI aspects
Project generation and scaffolding scripts
impressive_quotes: Production-ready framework extracting best practices from TFE
Clean separation of concerns optimized for maintainability

templates_and_starters.name: 3d-terminals-starter
templates_and_starters.description: Template for 3D scenes with working terminals using React Three Fiber and xterm.js
templates_and_starters.tagline: Interactive 3D environments with functional terminal emulators
key_features: Interactive 3D objects with click-to-flip mechanism
Real terminal access with full bash functionality
Persistent sessions (terminals stay alive when flipped back)
Visual effects: stars, dynamic lighting, glow effects
Complete backend with WebSocket-driven terminal lifecycle
xterm.js terminals rendered directly in 3D scene
implementation_highlights: WebSocket bridge pattern connecting React Three Fiber to xterm.js
React Three Fiber handles 3D UI and user interactions
node-pty spawns actual terminal processes
Bidirectional I/O piping through WebSocket
Modern separation of concerns architecture
impressive_quotes: Click 3D objects to reveal working bash shells embedded in a 3D scene
Terminals stay alive when you flip back
